answers.answer: This is just a general ? if anyone can help.........I'm waiting to test next Tuesday to see if I'm pregnant or not but all weekend I've have had very, very, light bleeding........it's been very light pink and nothing that would even put a dot on a pad or anything (sorry TMI).......no cramping or anything like that..........is any of this normal or has anyone experienced this and has still been pregnant? I know I won't know definitely until I test next Tuesday but I'd rather not get my hopes up if it's impossible.......thanks!!
Gave Maura the Nutramegin, she's throwing that up too. We have an appt at 11:20 with pedi. He better send us for follow up u/s.
The waiting game really sucks, doesn't it? It is definitely possible to have very light spotting and yes, still be pregnant. Only the stick will tell.... Good Luck!

I washed my curtains for the first time in three years (eek) a few months ago.  WOW!  What a difference.  I always thought they were cream coloured...but turns out they're white!  It IS amazing how dirty things get.  In the morning when I get out of the shower I can see the dust glistening on my bathroom wall too.I had a freak-out moment last night as I was getting ready for bed.  I've reached the point where I can feel hard bumps in my belly, like feet & bum (or whatever it is), and I as I was touching baby last night, it dawned on me that this little person is completely vulnerable and I am the main safekeeper and it scared me SOOOO much.  Just the idea of loving someone so much but also knowing that I won't be able to protect him/her all the time, even though I'm responsible.  And that little freak out turned into a "can I really do this? can I have a baby? my life is going to change so much" freak out.  DH is out of town working so I left a good old crying message on his truck phone.  The one good thing about crying is that I always have a good sleep after ;)

silly question but the radio station is having a contest and I really want to winDoes anyone know the last name of the family who took in the fresh prince of belair  (was the fresh prince from philly originally on teh show I mean)  The prize is a trip to mexico for whole family!

Im sure you will do a great job as a mother!You made this old witch cry..lol.It is scary but you know everything falls into place, Nothing is textbook, Ive had three what worked for one doesnt for the other, And even being older and had two before I still was nervous about the last one.But you know what I love the best, Your their mommy and whether your tall, short, fat, thin, they dont care they love you back with all their heart. They will look at you and smile like there she is my MOMMY.Yes I kinda thought my house was clean --til I started cleaning HOLY ****!  Flipped over the couch  I think someone must have been living under there!  Pencils, juice box (empty) gum wrappers, eek!  Told the kids no more eating in the Livingroom!Scary thing is I just did that about 3 months ago..

cinnamon.....please checkout the post made above. I normally do not comment on post like that but good greif.wisegirl..... i hope all goes well and you find out something. demand an ultrasound! hugs to maura and mommy! let me know.

Mgi--The name of the millionare family on fresh prince was Phillip and Vivian BANKSokay call the radio station and ill back my bags for the trip!lol.........Wisegirl---  Hope you get some answers and helpIs she still gaining weight?  xoxox Maura and mommy

thanks for the help.  One of my students just told me.  Know I have to wait for the signal to call.  If I win I'll send you a seuvenire - hows that.  Course it is a trip for four and there is only three of us - so I guess you could come.  My son is just dying to win.  Isn;t that funny - he is really into it!

Help, Im Hungry what can I and cannot eat when monitoring sugar intake?  My doctor said I need cut down on sugar as it was a bit high in my urine. He also said bread and milk had to be cut out. I am overweight, 15 weeks along, and my last baby was 9.2 pounds.  My last preganancy was fine.  My baby is 2 1/2 years now.  I have cut out anything with sugar, bread, potatoes, tortillas, ceareal etc.  I dont know what to eat?  Ok, salads, boiled eggs, but what else.  I had a banana for breakfast this morning about 7, its  now 11 and I am hungry and terrified to eat anything that may not be good for me. I am at the office and dont know what to eat.  My husband suggested to go home and eat beans and cheese.  Can anyone please suggest something.  I am hispanic and am used to eating quite spicy food, so alot of stuff tastes bland without salsa.  I am at my wits end. I dont want to get gestational diabetes but I dont want to injure my baby either.  I am scared, confused and hungry. Thanks for any help.Rose

Your sugars were found in your urine? Did he then test for gestational diabetes?I think that he wouldI was gestational this last pregnancy but controlled it with diet.What you can eat is proteins, meats, beans, nuts, if you have to watch your sugars that is breads, stuff with carbs in it.Fruit is okay but it is also high in sugar, Vegetables like lettuce, celery cucumber beans,  Tomatoes, corn, peas, and carrots believe it or not have sugar  Just limit these for nowThey usually do test later on in pregnancy  for diabetes.Limit them now and maybe it wont happen.hope this helped a bit.

someone on here before who had GD  made a great suggestion.  Those whole chickens from sams  (you can also get at meijer and kroger but not as good or as cheap)  you can eat those hot and the next day warm them up or snack on cold chicken all day long - it might be something to try.Cheese is good too.

We dont have a Sams here.  Do you mean chicken breasts cooked before hand?  The tough thing for me is I am not a big meat eater.  We had BBQ port ribs for dinner last night.  I love those but felt something was lacking. I was not satisfied.  I wanted to scrounge the kitchen for something. The beans department is no problem.  I love beans in any way shape or form, gotta stay away from the Baked beans though :)Rose

I think any meat is okay, so pepperoni shluld be acceptable.  Why not salsa?  Cottage cheese is an option, and you could spice it up a little.  I am a carb junkie,so I would cryif I had to cut out those things. Although, we cooked up some nice big steaks last night on the BBQ-- YUMMY!!! Good luck.

Thank you cin, I was not tested.  He said that there was sugar in my urine.  To control and cut back and next appointment(July 26th) we will check again to see if it is under control. I guess he wants to see if cutting back on the different food items will help.  My mom, sis and brother have diabetes. I am the only one who did not get it.  I am tested every year by my regular doctor to make sure that everthing is ok.  One thing I have noticed is that my mom, brother and sis are very large on top and have thin legs and arms.  I am overweight evenly. From head to toes. I was not always this big.  My last pregnancy was my weight gainer.  I just wish I had lost it before my second baby.  But oh well I have to wait until after the baby is born :)  Thanks for the help, it helps tons. What about eggs in any way shape or form? would that be ok? Pepperoni, salami, :)RoseDo they make a no carb cracker?  I need my fix :)

Actually what seems funny, is you can eat all the meat you want!! I would have to watch my breads, crackers,cereal(carbs) but could eat a cow!!Pepperoni, salami, yes, cheese  eggs you can have..I think I lived on them... and salads.There are low carb breads(which i did use) tricuits arent too bad   Its the white flour stuff and sugarsSounds like im talking to myself rose, my family has history of diabetes to and my first two pregnancies no diabetes this last one -yes  My sister is expecting twins anyday she was to gestational diabetic except she had to do insulin...good luck
Thanks everyone,  it helps so much!  I want to and eat right now! :)Rose

Wouldnt the tomatoes in the salsa be to sugary?  I can make salsa myself with onions, tomatoes and chiles and cilantro(coriander)and  a bit of salt. Thats all I need for fresh salsa or to make cooked salsa I just boil everything except the cilantro and add that after I blend in the blender.  I could make a green salsa.Rose

Tomatoes have sugar but he didnt say you have diabetes, Just limit it for now instead of having salsa say a cup have half a cup  and maybe only 2 times a week instead of threestuff like that ... its amazing just cutting back can help

Andrea is right!I also wondered if there wasn't something going on, like a partial obstruction with the amount of vomiting.  Usually, though, weight gain is very poor and the vomiting is projectile.  And typically it will be every single feed, not just the majority of them.Maybe she has it to a lesser extent and some food is getting through, enough to make it hard to diagnose.Good luck and keep us posted.

question: Hi girlsUp and at it early!Got into spring cleaning yesterday (although its almost summer)Took down curtains and blinds, washed windows- Boy stuff doesnt seem dirty until you get going and its amazing the difference!!
title: Open Forum for Tuesday
